content.description:
Turds in the Punchbowl climbs the tan-colored buttress to the right of Drive By Shooting.  Despite its proximity to its neightobr, the rock here is not nearly as good as the stone to the left.  There are pockets of excellent limestone, but there is also a good bit of spooky choss.

The line begins with a difficult, thrutchy crux on shattered rock, to get established in the low corner.  Easy moves up the steepening corner lead to a nice stance right on the prow.  The desparate crux follows, moving over the slight bulge via rounded sidepulls.  The juggy horizontal break above is a great relief.  Move up easier ledges on brown rock to the poor anchor.
content.protection: 10 Bolts.  Stick clip highly recommended for the difficult start on poor rock.  The anchor is two Metolius Rap Hangers.  Four screwlinks or two screlinks & some chain would really improve the situation at the top.
content.location:
Turds is the next bolted line right of

Drive By Shooting

.  Currently this is the third route right of the bolted dihedral.

From L->R:

Corporate Greed

, 5.9, bolted dihedral.

Snipe Hunter

, 12c, new route.

Drive By Shooting

, 11d.

Turds in the Punchbowl, "12a".

content.description: The crux is pulling through the notch over the bulge. The rock has a popcorn texture (ouch!), and the crux is way harder than the rest of the climbing, but will clean up with more traffic. I think it's pretty hard for the grade.
content.location: This route is just right of To Send is Bovine. The two routes share anchors.

content.description: A fun warm-up gives way to awkward traverse. Folks should know these easy routes are on this side of the canyon.
content.location:
Walk past

Turds

and

Bam

a couple hundred yards. After you see

Honeymoon

(with a little painted stone at the base), go around one more corner to get to Summer Shuffle and

Mouse

(also with their own painted rocks).

content.description: This route has three good rests. The first one is on a small ledge between the second and third bold. The second one is a small cave, between bolt 3 and 4, that allows for a no-hand rest. The third rest, if needed, requires a bit of a detour to the left of the route below the second to last bolt.
content.protection: 10 bolts with chain anchors at the top.
content.location:
This is the first route to the right of

Corporate Greed

(5.9).

content.description: Begin liebacking a crack feature. Clip the 3rd bolt, and start crimping your way up to the "baseball". The climbing eases up on the slab.
content.location:
Continue hiking past the Punchbowl proper past several other unsorted routes. This is the first route right of "

One Classy Bitch

;. I am hoping to get an area added to help sort out these routes.

content.description: Currently the first route on the left of the overhang, this amazing 11c starts from a sketchy belay, going to a large block that may fall off in 50 years. There is a glued hold just above the first bolt. The 3rd bolt starts the move to the right. A jug seems to magically appear whenever the holds run out. You may find yourself pumped out and epic-ing by the time you get to the somewhat of a downclimb crux near the last two bolts. Gain a good side pull, then jug to the last two convenient open gate anchors with a third bolt between the two with a biner. It's pretty sick to end 30 feet to the right of where you started, getting lowered past your belayer into the air of the huge open Punchbowl.
content.location: This is the first route on the left when you enter the area. There was a dead cow directly behind this route on the hill last time we were there (Labor Day '06).

content.description:
This route is an awesome all out pumpfest! It shares the same start as

Punchbowl Arch

and then continues to follow the arch out left pulling the final roof to the chain draws. The route has permadraws on all but the first bolt. If you are climbing at this grade, it is a must do. The red tag is still on the draw that separates it from

Punchbowl Arch

If you want to take the time to remove it, be my guest. You can own a piece of my backpack! Kneebars, finger crack, undercling, drop knees, pinches, crimpers, and jugs - this route has it all! A side note: it's not worth stopping to remove the tag.
content.location:
Do the same start as

Punchbowl Arch

.

content.description: This would probably fall under #3 for the Punchbowl area. Probably one of the best sport climbs in the universe. Crux is linking the moves on the roof and holding it together enough to pull around onto the face for more great technical climbing. I'm surprised this hasn't been sent yet, and the line is beautiful and inspiring in the midst of such an enchanted setting. Very intimidating as well. It may be harder than 13...
content.protection: 9 bolts I believe. One could use a large cam between the 8th and 9th as it is pretty run out (about 15-20 feet I believe) though with 5.10 climbing. If you've made it that far, you shouldn't have much to worry about.
content.location: Upon entering The Punchbowl, skirt along the bottom rim to the right until it goes uphill again for 30 feet or so. Rather than continuing uphill, cut back towards the cave and the first few bolts are the start of this gorgeous line.

content.description: This is a closed project. Bolting is not yet complete.
content.location: Between One Classy Bitch and Snake

content.description: Route starts at obvious sloper rail. Throw out right to a jug and try to figure your way up to a large ledge just under the arete. Follow the holds up the arete. Tough start and finish with some really great mellow climbing in between. NOTE- this is a brand new line 8/19/18. Helmets, if you're into that sort of thing would be advised. Even after all the cleaning there is probably some loose stuff still hanging on.
content.location:
This is the 2nd route left of "

Bam

". It is left of another closed project (which will also be cleaned and opened shortly).

content.description: The crux slaps you in the face at the fourth bolt.
content.location: This is the fifth route on the current topo. This is the first vertical route right of the cave proper.

content.description: Mouse has short, not very steep, climbing through a big ... of a chunky dihedral. Folks should know there are other warm-up/easy climbs on this side of the canyon.
content.protection: 5 bolts and an anchor with Mussie Hooks.
content.location:
Keep walking past

Turds

and

Bam

another couple hundred yards. After you pass

Honeymoon

(as painted on a little rock at the base), you'll come to

Summer Shuffle

and Mouse soon (also with painted rocks).

content.description: This was put up in 1997 on bolts and gear.
content.location:
This route is between

Spiked Punch

(12c) and

Corporate Greed

(9), #6 on the current topo.

content.description:
This is fun on the face through 3 bolts, then you traverse right and back left for some sneaky jugs (watch your left foot going over the 3rd). You can start all the way on the ground but will probably need to use the left stack at some point before the 2nd.

The name, by the way, may be off; I just wanted to get this on the Project, so people know there are easier climbs on the Punchbowl.

Eds. The name has been updated.
content.location:
This is past

Turds

and

Bam

a couple hundred yards, with a little painted rock at the base.

content.description:
This is a nice bolted extension to

Mouse

(5.8). Be careful for sucker holds. One cruxy move not far above the Mouse anchor will lead to cool mini-runnels on gray rock. Clip 3 bolts after the

Mouse

anchor to the top anchor. It is fun if you are there.
content.location:
Above

Mouse

on the right side of the Mouse Wall, it is right of

Sunshine Shuffle

. This is the rightmost side of the Punchbowl area.

climbs.name: Gray Block Right (submitted as Blue Route 1)

content.description:
Climb the short blue face just past

Snipe Hunter

. The crux is the first fifteen feet on big lockoffs to positive crimps.
content.location:
It is at The Punchbowl past

Snipe Hunter

. On the blue wall with two routes, this one is on the right.

climbs.name: Gray Block Left (submitted as Blue Route 2)

content.description:
Climb the short blue face around the corner from

Turds in the Punchbowl

route. The crux is the first move with another tricky sequence midway. It has great rock but is too short.
content.location:
The route is around the corner from

Turds in the Punchbowl

. On a short blue face, this is the first route on the left.

content.description:
This is a really good route, reminiscent of the

Project Wall in Rifle

. It may be 11d/12a.
content.location: On the topo, this is route #8.

content.description: This is a fun, short route.
content.protection: 5 bolts + 2 bolt anchor with Mussie hooks.
content.location:
This is the third route to the right of The Punch Bowl. The Punch Bowl is on the East side of the canyon. The East road ends just below a cave. The hike to the cave takes about two minutes.  Per

Chris Archer

: This short route climbs a left-facing dihedral just left of Snipe Hunter (12c).

content.description: Start with slabby climbing up and right. Get established on a small, right-facing dihedral/gigantic sidepull feature. Pull up over this and up and left and over a bulge with some positive holds.
content.location:
This is around 200 yards right of

Turds in the Punchbowl

.
